data.title: Official Broadway Website
data.meta_description: This season's most acclaimed new play, Stereophonic mines the agony and ecstasy of creation as it zooms in on a music studio in 1976.
data.text:
“ALREADY A MUST-SEE

AMERICAN CLASSIC. A STAGGERING, INGENIOUSLY

ENTERTAINING ACHIEVEMENT.”

“A BRILLIANT PIECE OF

MUST-SEE BROADWAY. STEREOPHONIC IS NOT TO BE MISSED.

DON’T WAIT. TICKETS WILL BE HARD TO GET.”

“ THEATRICAL SOLID GOLD. ALL THE

TINY DETAILS,

WILD RHYTHMS, AND

CLEVER HOOKS ADD UP

TO A BRAVE,

BREATHTAKING WORK.THE RESULT:

A CLASSIC.”

“AN EXCEPTIONAL

PIECE OF WORK AND ONE OF THE MOST EXHILARATING MOMENTS

I’VE EXPERIENCED IN A THEATER IN RECENT MEMORY.”

Stereophonic mines the agony and the ecstasy of creation as it zooms in on a music studio in 1976. Here, an up-and-coming rock band recording a new album finds itself suddenly on the cusp of superstardom. The ensuing pressures could spark their breakup â or their breakthrough. Written by David Adjmi, directed by Daniel Aukin, and featuring original music by Arcade Fire’s Will Butler, Stereophonic invites the audience to immerse themselves â with fly-on-the-wall intimacy â in the powder keg process of a band on the brink of blowing up.
